title: Rebuild as Reel/Short-Video App

requirements.text: Replace the current 3D car game frontend entirely with a reel-style short video/content feed app. The app should display a vertical, full-screen scrollable feed of video or content cards (reels), where users can swipe or scroll through individual items one at a time, similar to a social short-video experience.
acceptanceCriteria: The car game UI and 3D canvas are removed.
The main screen shows a vertical full-screen feed of reel/content cards.
Users can scroll or swipe to advance to the next reel.
Only one reel is visible/active at a time (full-screen per item).
The layout is responsive and works on a typical laptop browser.

requirements.text: Each reel card should display a placeholder video or looping animation, a title, a short description, a username/author label, and interaction icons (like, comment, share) aligned to the right side of the card in the style of a standard reel UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Each reel card shows a full-screen background video or looping placeholder.
Title and description text are overlaid on the card.
Username/author label is visible on each card.
Like, comment, and share action icons appear on the right side of the card.
Action icons are clearly visible against the video/card background.

requirements.text: Add a minimal top navigation bar with the app name/logo and optional tab navigation (e.g., 'For You', 'Following'). Apply a coherent visual theme with a dark background, bold typography, and vibrant accent colors (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette) that fits a modern short-video/reel aesthetic consistently across all screens.
acceptanceCriteria: A top navigation bar is present with the app name or logo.
At least two tab options (e.g., 'For You', 'Following') are shown in the nav.
A dark background theme is applied globally.
Accent color is not blue or purple.
Typography is bold and consistent across all screens.
Theme is applied consistently to nav, cards, and overlays.

requirements.text: Seed the feed with at least 5 mock reel items stored as static data in the frontend (no backend persistence required). Each mock reel must include a unique id, title, description, author name, and a placeholder looping video or animated visual (e.g., a colored gradient loop or a short looping clip from a public CDN).
acceptanceCriteria: At least 5 mock reel items are defined as static data.
Each item has a unique id, title, description, and author name.
Each item renders a looping video or animated visual as its background.
The feed renders all mock items in sequence.
No backend calls are made to fetch reel data.

requirements.text: Clear out the existing Motoko backend actor so it is a clean placeholder with no car game logic, ready for future reel-app features.
acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo contains only a minimal empty actor with no car game functions.
The backend compiles without errors.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not route generated image assets through the backend.
Do not use blue or purple as the primary accent color.
nonGoals: Real video upload or streaming infrastructure.
User authentication or accounts for this iteration.
Backend persistence of reels or user interactions.
Real-time features such as live comments or notifications.
Retaining any part of the 3D car game.

required: Bold wordmark logo for a short-video reel app with a dark background and vibrant accent color, horizontal layout (reel-logo.dim_400x100.png)
Small play/reel icon for use in navigation or card overlays, minimal flat style on transparent background (reel-icon.dim_64x64.png)
